heaviest_rainfall.status: On 09 November 2025, a record rainfall of 47.89mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  24.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 144.8 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 34.3mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 09 November 2025, the storm lasted 144.8 hours with a total precipitation of 47.89mm and it reached 24.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 06 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 3 cold snaps, usually there are 3.6 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 0 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (218°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 27 January 2026 with a value of 128.2 mph.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 1.5°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.6 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.6 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.2 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 26.5m higher than yesterday, 58.2m lower than the past week, 73.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 557m to a maximum of 849m, averaging 698.1m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 756.3m and 771.3m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Expect overcast skies with low cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and calm and still conditions are expected. Showers, overcast skies with low cloud, and overcast conditions will limit sunlight. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (96%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
